TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void CancelEventHandler(object sender, CancelEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed CancelEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub CancelEventHandler(sender As Object, e As CancelEventArgs)
type CancelEventHandler = delegate of obj * CancelEventArgs -> unit
public delegate void CancelEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, CancelEventArgs ^ e);
public delegate void CancelEventHandler(object? sender, CancelEventArgs e);

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that handles a cancelable event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create a <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventHandler> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event-handler method is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event-handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](/dotnet/standard/events/).
## Examples For an example of how to use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventHandler> delegate, please see the sample code in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs> class.
